messages.title: Five ways to get in touch
messages.content: At this election we face a choice. A choice between a Labour Government who will continue to drive Britain's economic recovery, and the Tories who will put this at risk. Between Labour MPs who will protect frontline public services for the many, and Tories who will prioritise tax cuts for the wealthy few.

Whether supporting our most vulnerable residents or fighting for our Cinema and Dog Track, my record shows my commitment to social justice and to acting on the issues that make a difference to us here. I'm standing to be our next local Labour MP to work for a better future for Walthamstow and Britain.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fighting for our Cinema and Dog Track to safeguard our local heritage and economy.
Securing jobs and investment for Walthamstow by working with businesses, voluntary groups and the public sector.
Tackling child poverty and household debt by supporting a London living wage.
Making our streets safer by lobbying for more police and addressing teen gang culture.
Leading local action on climate change to help protect our children's future.

issues.economy: A choice between a Labour Government who will continue to drive Britain's economic recovery, and the Tories who will put this at risk.
issues.environment: Leading local action on climate change to help protect our children's future.
issues.health: Making our streets safer by lobbying for more police and addressing teen gang culture.
issues.socialWelfare: Tackling child poverty and household debt by supporting a London living wage.

contactInformation.address: Stella Creasy, 23 Orford Road, Walthamstow, E17 9NL

leaflet.additionalNotes: Promoted by Amy Cods on behalf of Stella Creasy at 23 Orford Road, Walthamstow, E17 9NL. By Anton Group Ltd, Caxton Way, Thetford, Norfolk. Printed by Anton Group Ltd, Caxton Way, Thetford, Norfolk, E17 9NL.
